verses.text: And the boy Samuel served the LORD under Eli. In those days, the word of the LORD was rare; there were not many visions.
verses.comment: Notes that prophecy and visions from God were infrequent in this time.

verses.text: One day, Eli, whose eyes had begun to grow dim so that he could not see, was lying in his usual place.
verses.comment: Eli’s failing eyesight highlights his old age (cf. 1 Sam. 4:15).

verses.text: The lamp of God had not yet gone out, and Samuel was lying down in the temple of the LORD, where the ark of God was.
verses.comment: The lamp of God (menorah) was to burn from evening until morning (cf. Ex. 27:20–21).

verses.text: Then the LORD called Samuel, and he said, 'Here I am!'
verses.comment: 'Here I am' is a response showing readiness, as with Abraham.

verses.text: He ran to Eli and said, 'Here I am, for you called me.' But he said, 'I did not call; go back and lie down.' So he went and lay down.
verses.comment: Samuel assumes Eli was calling him, not recognizing the LORD’s voice yet.

verses.text: And the LORD called again, 'Samuel!' So Samuel arose and went to Eli and said, 'Here I am, for you called me.' But he said, 'I did not call, my son; go back and lie down.'
verses.comment: Repeated call emphasizes Samuel's initial lack of understanding of the divine call.

verses.text: Now Samuel did not yet know the LORD, and the word of the LORD had not yet been revealed to him.
verses.comment: Samuel had not yet experienced God's direct revelation.

verses.text: And the LORD called Samuel yet again, the third time. And he arose and went to Eli and said, 'Here I am, for you called me.' Then Eli understood that the LORD was calling the boy.
verses.comment: Eli, the priest, finally discerns that God is calling Samuel.

verses.text: So Eli said to Samuel, 'Go, lie down. And if He calls you, you shall say, “Speak, LORD, for Your servant is listening.”' So Samuel went and lay down in his place.
verses.comment: Eli instructs Samuel how to respond to the LORD properly.

verses.text: And the LORD came and stood and called as at the other times, 'Samuel! Samuel!' Then Samuel said, 'Speak, for Your servant is listening.'
verses.comment: Samuel omits 'LORD' (YHWH) in his address, possibly out of reverence or unfamiliarity.

verses.text: And the LORD said to Samuel, 'See, I am about to do something in Israel that will make the ears of everyone who hears it tingle.'
verses.comment: An idiom meaning a shocking or dreadful event is coming.

verses.text: On that day I will carry out against Eli all that I have spoken concerning his house, from beginning to end.
verses.comment: Refers back to the prophecy regarding Eli’s house.

verses.text: For I have told him that I am going to judge his house forever for the iniquity he knew about, because his sons were cursing God, and he did not restrain them.
verses.comment: Hebrew is ambiguous regarding 'cursing God'. Some manuscripts say 'bringing a curse upon themselves.'

verses.text: Therefore I have sworn to the house of Eli that the guilt of Eli's house shall never be atoned for by sacrifice or offering forever.'
verses.comment: Divine judgment is declared irreversible for Eli’s house.

verses.text: Samuel lay until morning; then he opened the doors of the house of the LORD. But Samuel was afraid to tell the vision to Eli.
verses.comment: Samuel fears revealing the severity of the message to his mentor.

verses.text: But Eli called Samuel and said, 'Samuel, my son.' And he said, 'Here I am.'
verses.comment: Eli continues to act tenderly toward Samuel, calling him 'my son.'

verses.text: And he said, 'What is the thing that He has said to you? Please do not hide it from me. May God deal with you, be it ever so severely, if you hide from me anything He told you.'
verses.comment: A solemn formula, often used to urge honesty.

verses.text: So Samuel told him everything and hid nothing from him. And he said, 'It is the LORD; let Him do what seems good to Him.'
verses.comment: Eli submits to God’s will, showing humility.

verses.text: And Samuel grew, and the LORD was with him and let none of his words fall to the ground.
verses.comment: None of Samuel’s prophetic words proved false.

verses.text: And all Israel from Dan to Beersheba knew that Samuel was established as a prophet of the LORD.
verses.comment: "Dan to Beersheba" means the whole land, north to south.

verses.text: And the LORD continued to appear at Shiloh, for the LORD revealed Himself to Samuel at Shiloh by the word of the LORD.
verses.comment: God’s word and revelation are restored in Israel, now through Samuel.
